00069 static char *osd_zerocopy_tag = "zerocopy";
00070 
00071 
00072 static void record_start_io(struct osd_device *osd, int rw, int discont_pages)
00073 {
00074         struct obd_histogram *h = osd->od_brw_stats.hist;
00075 
00076         if (rw == READ) {
00077                 atomic_inc(&osd->od_r_in_flight);
00078                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_R_RPC_HIST],
00079                                  atomic_read(&osd->od_r_in_flight));
00080                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_R_DISCONT_PAGES], discont_pages);
00081 
00082         } else {
00083                 atomic_inc(&osd->od_w_in_flight);
00084                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_W_RPC_HIST],
00085                                  atomic_read(&osd->od_w_in_flight));
00086                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&h[BRW_W_DISCONT_PAGES], discont_pages);
00087 
00088         }
00089 }
00090 
00091 static void record_end_io(struct osd_device *osd, int rw,
00092                           unsigned long elapsed, int disksize, int npages)
00093 {
00094         struct obd_histogram *h = osd->od_brw_stats.hist;
00095 
00096         if (rw == READ) {
00097                 atomic_dec(&osd->od_r_in_flight);
00098                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_R_PAGES], npages);
00099                 if (disksize > 0)
00100                         lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_R_DISK_IOSIZE], disksize);
00101                 if (elapsed)
00102                         lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_R_IO_TIME], elapsed);
00103 
00104         } else {
00105                 atomic_dec(&osd->od_w_in_flight);
00106                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_W_PAGES], npages);
00107                 if (disksize > 0)
00108                         lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_W_DISK_IOSIZE], disksize);
00109                 if (elapsed)
00110                         lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&h[BRW_W_IO_TIME], elapsed);
00111         }
00112 }
00113 
00114 static ssize_t osd_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00115                         struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *pos)
00116 {
00117         struct osd_object *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00118         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00119         uint64_t           old_size;
00120         int                size = buf->lb_len;
00121         int                rc;
00122         unsigned long      start;
00123 
00124         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00125         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00126 
00127         start = cfs_time_current();
00128 
00129         read_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00130         old_size = obj->oo_attr.la_size;
00131         read_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00132 
00133         if (*pos + size > old_size) {
00134                 if (old_size < *pos)
00135                         return 0;
00136                 else
00137                         size = old_size - *pos;
00138         }
00139 
00140         record_start_io(osd, READ, 0);
00141 
00142         rc = -dmu_read(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object, *pos, size,
00143                         buf->lb_buf, DMU_READ_PREFETCH);
00144 
00145         record_end_io(osd, READ, cfs_time_current() - start, size,
00146                       size >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00147         if (rc == 0) {
00148                 rc = size;
00149                 *pos += size;
00150         }
00151         return rc;
00152 }
00153 
00154 static ssize_t osd_declare_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00155                                 const struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t pos,
00156                                 struct thandle *th)
00157 {
00158         struct osd_object  *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00159         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00160         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00161         uint64_t            oid;
00162         ENTRY;
00163 
00164         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00165 
00166         /* in some cases declare can race with creation (e.g. llog)
00167          * and we need to wait till object is initialized. notice
00168          * LOHA_EXISTs is supposed to be the last step in the
00169          * initialization */
00170 
00171         /* declare possible size change. notice we can't check
00172          * current size here as another thread can change it */
00173 
00174         if (dt_object_exists(dt)) {
00175                 LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00176                 oid = obj->oo_db->db_object;
00177 
00178                 dmu_tx_hold_sa(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_sa_hdl, 0);
00179         } else {
00180                 oid = DMU_NEW_OBJECT;
00181                 dmu_tx_hold_sa_create(oh->ot_tx, ZFS_SA_BASE_ATTR_SIZE);
00182         }
00183 
00184         /* XXX: we still miss for append declaration support in ZFS
00185          *      -1 means append which is used by llog mostly, llog
00186          *      can grow upto LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE*8 records */
00187         if (pos == -1)
00188                 pos = max_t(loff_t, 256 * 8 * LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE,
00189                             obj->oo_attr.la_size + (2 << 20));
00190         dmu_tx_hold_write(oh->ot_tx, oid, pos, buf->lb_len);
00191 
00192         /* dt_declare_write() is usually called for system objects, such
00193          * as llog or last_rcvd files. We needn't enforce quota on those
00194          * objects, so always set the lqi_space as 0. */
00195         RETURN(osd_declare_quota(env, osd, obj->oo_attr.la_uid,
00196                                  obj->oo_attr.la_gid, 0, oh, true, NULL,
00197                                  false));
00198 }
00199 
00200 static ssize_t osd_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00201                         const struct lu_buf *buf, loff_t *pos,
00202                         struct thandle *th, int ignore_quota)
00203 {
00204         struct osd_object  *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00205         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00206         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00207         uint64_t            offset = *pos;
00208         int                 rc;
00209 
00210         ENTRY;
00211 
00212         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00213         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00214 
00215         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00216         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00217 
00218         record_start_io(osd, WRITE, 0);
00219 
00220         dmu_write(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object, offset,
00221                 (uint64_t)buf->lb_len, buf->lb_buf, oh->ot_tx);
00222         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00223         if (obj->oo_attr.la_size < offset + buf->lb_len) {
00224                 obj->oo_attr.la_size = offset + buf->lb_len;
00225                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00226                 /* osd_object_sa_update() will be copying directly from oo_attr
00227                  * into dbuf.  any update within a single txg will copy the
00228                  * most actual */
00229                 rc = osd_object_sa_update(obj, SA_ZPL_SIZE(osd),
00230                                         &obj->oo_attr.la_size, 8, oh);
00231                 if (unlikely(rc))
00232                         GOTO(out, rc);
00233         } else {
00234                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00235         }
00236 
00237         *pos += buf->lb_len;
00238         rc = buf->lb_len;
00239 
00240 out:
00241         record_end_io(osd, WRITE, 0, buf->lb_len,
00242                       buf->lb_len >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00243 
00244         RETURN(rc);
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*
00248  * XXX: for the moment I don't want to use lnb_flags for osd-internal
00249  *      purposes as it's not very well defined ...
00250  *      instead I use the lowest bit of the address so that:
00251  *        arc buffer:  .lnb_data = abuf          (arc we loan for write)
00252  *        dbuf buffer: .lnb_data = dbuf | 1      (dbuf we get for read)
00253  *        copy buffer: .lnb_page->mapping = obj (page we allocate for write)
00254  *
00255  *      bzzz, to blame
00256  */
00257 static int osd_bufs_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00258                         struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
00259 {
00260         struct osd_object *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00261         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00262         unsigned long      ptr;
00263         int                i;
00264 
00265         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00266         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00267 
00268         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00269                 if (lnb[i].lnb_page == NULL)
00270                         continue;
00271                 if (lnb[i].lnb_page->mapping == (void *)obj) {
00272                         /* this is anonymous page allocated for copy-write */
00273                         lnb[i].lnb_page->mapping = NULL;
00274                         __free_page(lnb[i].lnb_page);
00275                         atomic_dec(&osd->od_zerocopy_alloc);
00276                 } else {
00277                         /* see comment in osd_bufs_get_read() */
00278                         ptr = (unsigned long)lnb[i].lnb_data;
00279                         if (ptr & 1UL) {
00280                                 ptr &= ~1UL;
00281                                 dmu_buf_rele((void *)ptr, osd_zerocopy_tag);
00282                                 atomic_dec(&osd->od_zerocopy_pin);
00283                         } else if (lnb[i].lnb_data != NULL) {
00284                                 dmu_return_arcbuf(lnb[i].lnb_data);
00285                                 atomic_dec(&osd->od_zerocopy_loan);
00286                         }
00287                 }
00288                 lnb[i].lnb_page = NULL;
00289                 lnb[i].lnb_data = NULL;
00290         }
00291 
00292         return 0;
00293 }
00294 
00295 static inline struct page *kmem_to_page(void *addr)
00296 {
00297         if (is_vmalloc_addr(addr))
00298                 return vmalloc_to_page(addr);
00299         else
00300                 return virt_to_page(addr);
00301 }
00302 
00323 static int osd_bufs_get_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
00324                                 loff_t off, ssize_t len, struct niobuf_local *lnb)
00325 {
00326         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00327         unsigned long      start = cfs_time_current();
00328         int                rc, i, numbufs, npages = 0;
00329         dmu_buf_t        **dbp;
00330         ENTRY;
00331 
00332         record_start_io(osd, READ, 0);
00333 
00334         /* grab buffers for read:
00335          * OSD API let us to grab buffers first, then initiate IO(s)
00336          * so that all required IOs will be done in parallel, but at the
00337          * moment DMU doesn't provide us with a method to grab buffers.
00338          * If we discover this is a vital for good performance we
00339          * can get own replacement for dmu_buf_hold_array_by_bonus().
00340          */
00341         while (len > 0) {
00342                 rc = -dmu_buf_hold_array_by_bonus(obj->oo_db, off, len, TRUE,
00343                                                   osd_zerocopy_tag, &numbufs,
00344                                                   &dbp);
00345                 if (unlikely(rc))
00346                         GOTO(err, rc);
00347 
00348                 for (i = 0; i < numbufs; i++) {
00349                         int bufoff, tocpy, thispage;
00350                         void *dbf = dbp[i];
00351 
00352                         LASSERT(len > 0);
00353 
00354                         atomic_inc(&osd->od_zerocopy_pin);
00355 
00356                         bufoff = off - dbp[i]->db_offset;
00357                         tocpy = min_t(int, dbp[i]->db_size - bufoff, len);
00358 
00359                         /* kind of trick to differentiate dbuf vs. arcbuf */
00360                         LASSERT(((unsigned long)dbp[i] & 1) == 0);
00361                         dbf = (void *) ((unsigned long)dbp[i] | 1);
00362 
00363                         while (tocpy > 0) {
00364                                 thispage = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
00365                                 thispage -= bufoff & (PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1);
00366                                 thispage = min(tocpy, thispage);
00367 
00368                                 lnb->lnb_rc = 0;
00369                                 lnb->lnb_file_offset = off;
00370                                 lnb->lnb_page_offset = bufoff & ~PAGE_MASK;
00371                                 lnb->lnb_len = thispage;
00372                                 lnb->lnb_page = kmem_to_page(dbp[i]->db_data +
00373                                                              bufoff);
00374                                 /* mark just a single slot: we need this
00375                                  * reference to dbuf to be released once */
00376                                 lnb->lnb_data = dbf;
00377                                 dbf = NULL;
00378 
00379                                 tocpy -= thispage;
00380                                 len -= thispage;
00381                                 bufoff += thispage;
00382                                 off += thispage;
00383 
00384                                 npages++;
00385                                 lnb++;
00386                         }
00387 
00388                         /* steal dbuf so dmu_buf_rele_array() can't release
00389                          * it */
00390                         dbp[i] = NULL;
00391                 }
00392 
00393                 dmu_buf_rele_array(dbp, numbufs, osd_zerocopy_tag);
00394         }
00395 
00396         record_end_io(osd, READ, cfs_time_current() - start,
00397                       npages * PAGE_SIZE, npages);
00398 
00399         RETURN(npages);
00400 
00401 err:
00402         LASSERT(rc < 0);
00403         osd_bufs_put(env, &obj->oo_dt, lnb - npages, npages);
00404         RETURN(rc);
00405 }
00406 
00407 static int osd_bufs_get_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_object *obj,
00408                                 loff_t off, ssize_t len, struct niobuf_local *lnb)
00409 {
00410         struct osd_device *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00411         int                plen, off_in_block, sz_in_block;
00412         int                rc, i = 0, npages = 0;
00413         arc_buf_t         *abuf;
00414         uint32_t           bs;
00415         uint64_t           dummy;
00416         ENTRY;
00417 
00418         dmu_object_size_from_db(obj->oo_db, &bs, &dummy);
00419 
00420         /*
00421          * currently only full blocks are subject to zerocopy approach:
00422          * so that we're sure nobody is trying to update the same block
00423          */
00424         while (len > 0) {
00425                 LASSERT(npages < PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES);
00426 
00427                 off_in_block = off & (bs - 1);
00428                 sz_in_block = min_t(int, bs - off_in_block, len);
00429 
00430                 if (sz_in_block == bs) {
00431                         /* full block, try to use zerocopy */
00432 
00433                         abuf = dmu_request_arcbuf(obj->oo_db, bs);
00434                         if (unlikely(abuf == NULL))
00435                                 GOTO(out_err, rc = -ENOMEM);
00436 
00437                         atomic_inc(&osd->od_zerocopy_loan);
00438 
00439                         /* go over pages arcbuf contains, put them as
00440                          * local niobufs for ptlrpc's bulks */
00441                         while (sz_in_block > 0) {
00442                                 plen = min_t(int, sz_in_block, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00443 
00444                                 lnb[i].lnb_file_offset = off;
00445                                 lnb[i].lnb_page_offset = 0;
00446                                 lnb[i].lnb_len = plen;
00447                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = 0;
00448                                 if (sz_in_block == bs)
00449                                         lnb[i].lnb_data = abuf;
00450                                 else
00451                                         lnb[i].lnb_data = NULL;
00452 
00453                                 /* this one is not supposed to fail */
00454                                 lnb[i].lnb_page = kmem_to_page(abuf->b_data +
00455                                                         off_in_block);
00456                                 LASSERT(lnb[i].lnb_page);
00457 
00458                                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats,
00459                                                 LPROC_OSD_ZEROCOPY_IO, 1);
00460 
00461                                 sz_in_block -= plen;
00462                                 len -= plen;
00463                                 off += plen;
00464                                 off_in_block += plen;
00465                                 i++;
00466                                 npages++;
00467                         }
00468                 } else {
00469                         if (off_in_block == 0 && len < bs &&
00470                                         off + len >= obj->oo_attr.la_size)
00471                                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats,
00472                                                 LPROC_OSD_TAIL_IO, 1);
00473 
00474                         /* can't use zerocopy, allocate temp. buffers */
00475                         while (sz_in_block > 0) {
00476                                 plen = min_t(int, sz_in_block, PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00477 
00478                                 lnb[i].lnb_file_offset = off;
00479                                 lnb[i].lnb_page_offset = 0;
00480                                 lnb[i].lnb_len = plen;
00481                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = 0;
00482                                 lnb[i].lnb_data = NULL;
00483 
00484                                 lnb[i].lnb_page = alloc_page(OSD_GFP_IO);
00485                                 if (unlikely(lnb[i].lnb_page == NULL))
00486                                         GOTO(out_err, rc = -ENOMEM);
00487 
00488                                 LASSERT(lnb[i].lnb_page->mapping == NULL);
00489                                 lnb[i].lnb_page->mapping = (void *)obj;
00490 
00491                                 atomic_inc(&osd->od_zerocopy_alloc);
00492                                 lprocfs_counter_add(osd->od_stats,
00493                                                 LPROC_OSD_COPY_IO, 1);
00494 
00495                                 sz_in_block -= plen;
00496                                 len -= plen;
00497                                 off += plen;
00498                                 i++;
00499                                 npages++;
00500                         }
00501                 }
00502         }
00503 
00504         RETURN(npages);
00505 
00506 out_err:
00507         osd_bufs_put(env, &obj->oo_dt, lnb, npages);
00508         RETURN(rc);
00509 }
00510 
00511 static int osd_bufs_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00512                         loff_t offset, ssize_t len, struct niobuf_local *lnb,
00513                         int rw)
00514 {
00515         struct osd_object *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00516         int                rc;
00517 
00518         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00519         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00520 
00521         if (rw == 0)
00522                 rc = osd_bufs_get_read(env, obj, offset, len, lnb);
00523         else
00524                 rc = osd_bufs_get_write(env, obj, offset, len, lnb);
00525 
00526         return rc;
00527 }
00528 
00529 static int osd_write_prep(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00530                         struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
00531 {
00532         struct osd_object *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00533 
00534         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00535         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00536 
00537         return 0;
00538 }
00539 
00540 static inline uint32_t osd_get_blocksz(struct osd_object *obj)
00541 {
00542         uint32_t blksz;
00543         u_longlong_t unused;
00544 
00545         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00546 
00547         dmu_object_size_from_db(obj->oo_db, &blksz, &unused);
00548         return blksz;
00549 }
00550 
00551 static inline uint64_t osd_roundup2blocksz(uint64_t size,
00552                                            uint64_t offset,
00553                                            uint32_t blksz)
00554 {
00555         LASSERT(blksz > 0);
00556 
00557         size += offset % blksz;
00558 
00559         if (likely(IS_PO2(blksz)))
00560                 return PO2_ROUNDUP_TYPED(size, blksz, uint64_t);
00561 
00562         size += blksz - 1;
00563         do_div(size, blksz);
00564         return size * blksz;
00565 }
00566 
00567 static int osd_declare_write_commit(const struct lu_env *env,
00568                                     struct dt_object *dt,
00569                                     struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages,
00570                                     struct thandle *th)
00571 {
00572         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00573         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00574         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00575         uint64_t            offset = 0;
00576         uint32_t            size = 0;
00577         uint32_t            blksz = osd_get_blocksz(obj);
00578         int                 i, rc, flags = 0;
00579         bool                ignore_quota = false, synced = false;
00580         long long           space = 0;
00581         struct page        *last_page = NULL;
00582         unsigned long       discont_pages = 0;
00583         ENTRY;
00584 
00585         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00586         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00587 
00588         LASSERT(lnb);
00589         LASSERT(npages > 0);
00590 
00591         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00592 
00593         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00594                 if (last_page && lnb[i].lnb_page->index != (last_page->index + 1))
00595                         ++discont_pages;
00596                 last_page = lnb[i].lnb_page;
00597                 if (lnb[i].lnb_rc)
00598                         /* ENOSPC, network RPC error, etc.
00599                          * We don't want to book space for pages which will be
00600                          * skipped in osd_write_commit(). Hence we skip pages
00601                          * with lnb_rc != 0 here too */
00602                         continue;
00603                 /* ignore quota for the whole request if any page is from
00604                  * client cache or written by root.
00605                  *
00606                  * XXX once we drop the 1.8 client support, the checking
00607                  * for whether page is from cache can be simplified as:
00608                  * !(lnb[i].flags & OBD_BRW_SYNC)
00609                  *
00610                  * XXX we could handle this on per-lnb basis as done by
00611                  * grant. */
00612                 if ((lnb[i].lnb_flags & OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA) ||
00613                     (lnb[i].lnb_flags & (OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT | OBD_BRW_SYNC)) ==
00614                     OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT)
00615                         ignore_quota = true;
00616                 if (size == 0) {
00617                         /* first valid lnb */
00618                         offset = lnb[i].lnb_file_offset;
00619                         size = lnb[i].lnb_len;
00620                         continue;
00621                 }
00622                 if (offset + size == lnb[i].lnb_file_offset) {
00623                         /* this lnb is contiguous to the previous one */
00624                         size += lnb[i].lnb_len;
00625                         continue;
00626                 }
00627 
00628                 dmu_tx_hold_write(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00629                                   offset, size);
00630                 /* Estimating space to be consumed by a write is rather
00631                  * complicated with ZFS. As a consequence, we don't account for
00632                  * indirect blocks and just use as a rough estimate the worse
00633                  * case where the old space is being held by a snapshot. Quota
00634                  * overrun will be adjusted once the operation is committed, if
00635                  * required. */
00636                 space += osd_roundup2blocksz(size, offset, blksz);
00637 
00638                 offset = lnb[i].lnb_file_offset;
00639                 size = lnb[i].lnb_len;
00640         }
00641 
00642         if (size) {
00643                 dmu_tx_hold_write(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00644                                   offset, size);
00645                 space += osd_roundup2blocksz(size, offset, blksz);
00646         }
00647 
00648         dmu_tx_hold_sa(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_sa_hdl, 0);
00649 
00650         oh->ot_write_commit = 1; /* used in osd_trans_start() for fail_loc */
00651 
00652         /* backend zfs filesystem might be configured to store multiple data
00653          * copies */
00654         space  *= osd->od_os->os_copies;
00655         space   = toqb(space);
00656         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "writing %d pages, reserving "LPD64"K of quota space\n",
00657                npages, space);
00658 
00659         record_start_io(osd, WRITE, discont_pages);
00660 retry:
00661         /* acquire quota space if needed */
00662         rc = osd_declare_quota(env, osd, obj->oo_attr.la_uid,
00663                                obj->oo_attr.la_gid, space, oh, true, &flags,
00664                                ignore_quota);
00665 
00666         if (!synced && rc == -EDQUOT && (flags & QUOTA_FL_SYNC) != 0) {
00667                 dt_sync(env, th->th_dev);
00668                 synced = true;
00669                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "retry after sync\n");
00670                 flags = 0;
00671                 goto retry;
00672         }
00673 
00674         /* we need only to store the overquota flags in the first lnb for
00675          * now, once we support multiple objects BRW, this code needs be
00676          * revised. */
00677         if (flags & QUOTA_FL_OVER_USRQUOTA)
00678                 lnb[0].lnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_OVER_USRQUOTA;
00679         if (flags & QUOTA_FL_OVER_GRPQUOTA)
00680                 lnb[0].lnb_flags |= OBD_BRW_OVER_GRPQUOTA;
00681 
00682         RETURN(rc);
00683 }
00684 
00685 static int osd_write_commit(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00686                         struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages,
00687                         struct thandle *th)
00688 {
00689         struct osd_object  *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00690         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00691         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00692         uint64_t            new_size = 0;
00693         int                 i, rc = 0;
00694         unsigned long      iosize = 0;
00695         ENTRY;
00696 
00697         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00698         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00699 
00700         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00701         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00702 
00703         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00704                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "write %u bytes at %u\n",
00705                         (unsigned) lnb[i].lnb_len,
00706                         (unsigned) lnb[i].lnb_file_offset);
00707 
00708                 if (lnb[i].lnb_rc) {
00709                         /* ENOSPC, network RPC error, etc.
00710                          * Unlike ldiskfs, zfs allocates new blocks on rewrite,
00711                          * so we skip this page if lnb_rc is set to -ENOSPC */
00712                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "obj "DFID": skipping lnb[%u]: rc=%d\n",
00713                                 PFID(lu_object_fid(&dt->do_lu)), i,
00714                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc);
00715                         continue;
00716                 }
00717 
00718                 if (lnb[i].lnb_page->mapping == (void *)obj) {
00719                         dmu_write(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00720                                 lnb[i].lnb_file_offset, lnb[i].lnb_len,
00721                                 kmap(lnb[i].lnb_page), oh->ot_tx);
00722                         kunmap(lnb[i].lnb_page);
00723                 } else if (lnb[i].lnb_data) {
00724                         LASSERT(((unsigned long)lnb[i].lnb_data & 1) == 0);
00725                         /* buffer loaned for zerocopy, try to use it.
00726                          * notice that dmu_assign_arcbuf() is smart
00727                          * enough to recognize changed blocksize
00728                          * in this case it fallbacks to dmu_write() */
00729                         dmu_assign_arcbuf(obj->oo_db, lnb[i].lnb_file_offset,
00730                                           lnb[i].lnb_data, oh->ot_tx);
00731                         /* drop the reference, otherwise osd_put_bufs()
00732                          * will be releasing it - bad! */
00733                         lnb[i].lnb_data = NULL;
00734                         atomic_dec(&osd->od_zerocopy_loan);
00735                 }
00736 
00737                 if (new_size < lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len)
00738                         new_size = lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len;
00739                 iosize += lnb[i].lnb_len;
00740         }
00741 
00742         if (unlikely(new_size == 0)) {
00743                 /* no pages to write, no transno is needed */
00744                 th->th_local = 1;
00745                 /* it is important to return 0 even when all lnb_rc == -ENOSPC
00746                  * since ofd_commitrw_write() retries several times on ENOSPC */
00747                 record_end_io(osd, WRITE, 0, 0, 0);
00748                 RETURN(0);
00749         }
00750 
00751         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00752         if (obj->oo_attr.la_size < new_size) {
00753                 obj->oo_attr.la_size = new_size;
00754                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00755                 /* osd_object_sa_update() will be copying directly from
00756                  * oo_attr into dbuf. any update within a single txg will copy
00757                  * the most actual */
00758                 rc = osd_object_sa_update(obj, SA_ZPL_SIZE(osd),
00759                                           &obj->oo_attr.la_size, 8, oh);
00760         } else {
00761                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00762         }
00763 
00764         record_end_io(osd, WRITE, 0, iosize, npages);
00765 
00766         RETURN(rc);
00767 }
00768 
00769 static int osd_read_prep(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00770                         struct niobuf_local *lnb, int npages)
00771 {
00772         struct osd_object *obj  = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00773         int                i;
00774         loff_t             eof;
00775 
00776         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00777         LASSERT(obj->oo_db);
00778 
00779         read_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00780         eof = obj->oo_attr.la_size;
00781         read_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00782 
00783         for (i = 0; i < npages; i++) {
00784                 if (unlikely(lnb[i].lnb_rc < 0))
00785                         continue;
00786 
00787                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = lnb[i].lnb_len;
00788 
00789                 if (lnb[i].lnb_file_offset + lnb[i].lnb_len >= eof) {
00790                         if (eof <= lnb[i].lnb_file_offset)
00791                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = 0;
00792                         else
00793                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = eof - lnb[i].lnb_file_offset;
00794 
00795                         /* all subsequent rc should be 0 */
00796                         while (++i < npages)
00797                                 lnb[i].lnb_rc = 0;
00798                         break;
00799                 }
00800         }
00801 
00802         return 0;
00803 }
00804 
00805 /*
00806  * Punch/truncate an object
00807  *
00808  *      IN:     db  - dmu_buf of the object to free data in.
00809  *              off - start of section to free.
00810  *              len - length of section to free (DMU_OBJECT_END => to EOF).
00811  *
00812  *      RETURN: 0 if success
00813  *              error code if failure
00814  *
00815  * The transaction passed to this routine must have
00816  * dmu_tx_hold_sa() and if off < size, dmu_tx_hold_free()
00817  * called and then assigned to a transaction group.
00818  */
00819 static int __osd_object_punch(objset_t *os, dmu_buf_t *db, dmu_tx_t *tx,
00820                                 uint64_t size, uint64_t off, uint64_t len)
00821 {
00822         int rc = 0;
00823 
00824         /* Assert that the transaction has been assigned to a
00825            transaction group. */
00826         LASSERT(tx->tx_txg != 0);
00827         /*
00828          * Nothing to do if file already at desired length.
00829          */
00830         if (len == DMU_OBJECT_END && size == off)
00831                 return 0;
00832 
00833         if (off < size)
00834                 rc = -dmu_free_range(os, db->db_object, off, len, tx);
00835 
00836         return rc;
00837 }
00838 
00839 static int osd_punch(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00840                         __u64 start, __u64 end, struct thandle *th)
00841 {
00842         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00843         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00844         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00845         __u64               len;
00846         int                 rc = 0;
00847         ENTRY;
00848 
00849         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(dt));
00850         LASSERT(osd_invariant(obj));
00851 
00852         LASSERT(th != NULL);
00853         oh = container_of0(th, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00854 
00855         write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00856         /* truncate */
00857         if (end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF || end >= obj->oo_attr.la_size)
00858                 len = DMU_OBJECT_END;
00859         else
00860                 len = end - start;
00861         write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00862 
00863         rc = __osd_object_punch(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db, oh->ot_tx,
00864                                 obj->oo_attr.la_size, start, len);
00865         /* set new size */
00866         if (len == DMU_OBJECT_END) {
00867                 write_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00868                 obj->oo_attr.la_size = start;
00869                 write_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00870                 rc = osd_object_sa_update(obj, SA_ZPL_SIZE(osd),
00871                                           &obj->oo_attr.la_size, 8, oh);
00872         }
00873         RETURN(rc);
00874 }
00875 
00876 static int osd_declare_punch(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00877                         __u64 start, __u64 end, struct thandle *handle)
00878 {
00879         struct osd_object  *obj = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00880         struct osd_device  *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00881         struct osd_thandle *oh;
00882         __u64               len;
00883         ENTRY;
00884 
00885         oh = container_of0(handle, struct osd_thandle, ot_super);
00886 
00887         read_lock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00888         if (end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF || end >= obj->oo_attr.la_size)
00889                 len = DMU_OBJECT_END;
00890         else
00891                 len = end - start;
00892 
00893         /* declare we'll free some blocks ... */
00894         if (start < obj->oo_attr.la_size) {
00895                 read_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00896                 dmu_tx_hold_free(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_db->db_object, start, len);
00897         } else {
00898                 read_unlock(&obj->oo_attr_lock);
00899         }
00900 
00901         /* ... and we'll modify size attribute */
00902         dmu_tx_hold_sa(oh->ot_tx, obj->oo_sa_hdl, 0);
00903 
00904         RETURN(osd_declare_quota(env, osd, obj->oo_attr.la_uid,
00905                                  obj->oo_attr.la_gid, 0, oh, true, NULL,
00906                                  false));
00907 }
00908 
00909 static int osd_ladvise(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *dt,
00910                        __u64 start, __u64 end, enum lu_ladvise_type advice)
00911 {
00912         int     rc;
00913         ENTRY;
00914 
00915         switch (advice) {
00916         default:
00917                 rc = -ENOTSUPP;
00918                 break;
00919         }
00920 
00921         RETURN(rc);
00922 }
00923 
00924 struct dt_body_operations osd_body_ops = {
00925         .dbo_read                       = osd_read,
00926         .dbo_declare_write              = osd_declare_write,
00927         .dbo_write                      = osd_write,
00928         .dbo_bufs_get                   = osd_bufs_get,
00929         .dbo_bufs_put                   = osd_bufs_put,
00930         .dbo_write_prep                 = osd_write_prep,
00931         .dbo_declare_write_commit       = osd_declare_write_commit,
00932         .dbo_write_commit               = osd_write_commit,
00933         .dbo_read_prep                  = osd_read_prep,
00934         .dbo_declare_punch              = osd_declare_punch,
00935         .dbo_punch                      = osd_punch,
00936         .dbo_ladvise                    = osd_ladvise,
00937 };
